text: Thomas Banks (10 November 1929 - 13 June 2024) was an English footballer. He played for Bolton Wanderers from 1947 to 1961, and six matches for the England national football team in 1958, including all four matches in the 1958 FIFA World Cup. Banks died on 13 June 2024 from problems caused by dementia, at the age of 94. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:English footballers Category:Sportspeople from Lancashire Category:1929 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia
title: Tommy Banks
